title: The Blind Gambler is Actually a Marine Admiral
theoryText: After Episode 630 aired, many fans immediately theorized that the mysterious blind gambler who Zoro encountered was not just a random character, but likely one of the two new Marine Admirals recruited during the timeskip. His calm demeanor, the sword concealed in his cane, and Zoro's instinctive wariness all pointed to this character being extremely powerful and important to the story.
author: One Piece Community (Multiple Users)
statusNote: Confirmed in later episodes when Fujitora reveals his identity as Marine Admiral

title: The Living Toys Are Transformed Humans
theoryText: When viewers first saw the living toys in Episode 630, many fans immediately speculated that these toys were not simply animated objects, but actually transformed humans. The theory suggested that a Devil Fruit user on Dressrosa had the power to turn people into toys, possibly erasing memories of their human existence. This would explain why the toys seem so lifelike and why Dressrosa's culture treats them as normal citizens.
author: One Piece Community (Multiple Users)
statusNote: Confirmed when Sugar and the Hobi Hobi no Mi's true power was revealed

title: Fujitora Blinded Himself Intentionally
theoryText: Early fan theories about Fujitora speculated on the reason for his blindness. Some fans theorized that he wasn't born blind or injured in battle, but rather chose to blind himself intentionally, possibly after witnessing something so horrible that he no longer wanted to see the world's corruption and cruelty. This would fit with his calm, philosophical demeanor and his presence in Dressrosa, a place with hidden darkness beneath its beautiful surface.
author: One Piece Community (Reddit/Forums)
statusNote: Later confirmed that Fujitora did indeed blind himself after seeing the world's atrocities

sources.title: One Piece: 10 Things Every Fan Should Know About Fujitora

title: Doflamingo's Control Over Dressrosa Has Dark Secrets
theoryText: From Episode 630, fans theorized that Dressrosa's seemingly perfect paradise facade was hiding something sinister. The presence of living toys, the fact that Doflamingo's thugs openly cheat and bully people, and the overall 'too good to be true' atmosphere led to theories that Doflamingo's rule was actually tyrannical and that the island's happiness was forced or fabricated. The toys were seen as the key to uncovering Dressrosa's dark secret.
author: One Piece Community (Multiple Platforms)
statusNote: Confirmed as the arc progressed, revealing Doflamingo's tyrannical rule and the tragedy of the toys

title: Fujitora Has Gravity-Based Devil Fruit Powers
theoryText: Based on his introduction in Episode 630 and early manga readers' knowledge, anime-only fans began theorizing about what Devil Fruit power the blind gambler might possess. Some correctly guessed that his powers would be gravity-based, allowing him to sense his surroundings despite his blindness and explaining his confident, calm demeanor. The theory suggested he could manipulate gravitational forces, making him an extremely powerful opponent.
author: One Piece Community (Manga Readers & Theorists)
statusNote: Confirmed when Fujitora demonstrates his Zushi Zushi no Mi powers
